Package calculators

Class Calculator

java.lang.Object
calculators.Calculator
Direct Known Subclasses:
CalculatorAdvanced
public class Calculator extends Object
A class representing a simple calculator that performs basic arithmetic operations. The calculator holds a current value, which can be manipulated using various operations. Supported operations include addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. The calculator also handles exceptions for division by zero and unsupported operations.
Since:
2024-12-12
Version:
1.0
Author:
Tamara Kosovac

    • calculate

      public void calculate(Double value, char operator) throws DivisionByZeroException, NotSupportedOperationException
      Performs a basic arithmetic calculation based on the provided operator. Supports addition ('+'), subtraction ('-'), multiplication ('*'), and division ('/'). If the operator is not supported or if there is an attempt to divide by zero, exceptions are thrown.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to operate with.
      operator - The operator representing the arithmetic operation.
      Throws:
      DivisionByZeroException - If division by zero is attempted.
      NotSupportedOperationException - If the operator is not one of the supported operations.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided value is null.
